sen.j: この寺は、1548年（天文 (元号)17年）武蔵国江戸の出身で江戸増上寺で学んだ縁誉称念（1513年～1554年）が、京都青蓮院宮から寺地を下賜されて創建したものである。
sen.e: This temple was founded in 1548 by Enyo-shonen (1513 ~ 1554) who was born in Edo, Musashi Province and studied at Edo Zojo-ji Temple when he was given the premises of the temple by Kyoto Shorenin no miya.

sen.j: 天保9年10月（1838年11月～12月）のある夜、時の知恩院門主であった尊超入道親王が、夢の中で白鶴の群れが一心院の裏山に飛来する光景を見て吉祥と感じ、当時山号のなかった一心院に「郡仙山」の山号を名付けた。
sen.e: A night in October in Tenpo 9 (of lunar calendar) (November to December in 1838), Imperial Prince Soncho Nyudo, the head priest of Chion-in at the time saw a scene that a bevy of swans came flew to the small mountain at the back of Isshin-in in the dream and felt it as a good omen, and named a sango "Gunsenzan" to Isshin-in Temple as it has no sango at the time.

A night in October of Tenpo 9 (on the lunar calendar) (November to December of 1838), Imperial Prince Soncho Nyudo, who was then the head priest of Chion-in, had a dream in which a bevy of swans flew to the small mountain at the back of Isshin-in; he believed it was a good omen, and thus gave Isshin-in Temple the sango "Gunsenzan," since it had no other.
